content:
This section explains how to set the collide masks for collision detection in Panda3D, specifically demonstrating the Python and C++ code required to configure the "from" and "into" masks on nodes and their children.

python

nodePath.node().setFromCollideMask(BitMask32(0x10))

cpp

node_path.node()->set_from_collide_mask(BitMask32(0x10));

However, the into collide mask may be set on the NodePath, for convenience; this recursively modifies the into collide mask for all the nodes at the given NodePath level and below.

python

nodePath.setCollideMask(newMask, bitsToChange, nodeType)

cpp

node_path.set_collide_mask(new_mask, bits_to_change, node_type);
